system.description:
You can spend 1 AP and 1 MP to create your own Druid Grove within 5 Spaces of you.

Make a DC 10 Spell Check.

Success: You create 6 Grove Spaces along the ground or walls. You can place your Grove Spaces in any locations you can see, as long as each Grove Space is connected to at least 1 other Grove Space.

Success (each 5): You create +2 Grove Spaces.

Failure: You create 4 Grove Spaces

Grove Spaces: Each Space of your Grove is filled with vines and small plant life, and is considered to be Difficult Terrain for creatures of your choice.

Gaining Grove Spaces: If you use this Feature again, you can choose to make a new segment of Grove Spaces separate or connected to an existing segment of Grove Spaces.
You can support up to a maximum of 20 Grove Spaces at a time. If you create additional Grove Spaces beyond 20, an equal number of existing Grove Spaces of your choice immediately wilt and disappear.

Losing Grove Spaces: A Grove Space also disappears if you end your turn farther than 15 Spaces away from it, you die, the Space is the target of an effect dealing Fire damage, or a creature standing within its Space takes Fire damage.

Grove Actions

While you have Grove Spaces, you can take any of the following Grove Actions:

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.ftUxTIuBWa387Cox]{Wild Growth}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.3MZILpZaLUjznzro]{Grasping Vines}
